name: Alysha Chan
bio:
Hello! My name's Alysha and I’m a senior at the University of Utah, currently completing my Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science. Throughout my academic journey, my interests within computing are software engineering, human-centered interaction, and full-stack development. I am passionate about creating user-focused technologies to benefit human experiences.
 In addition to being a member of the Job Preppers capstone team, I’ve also interned at Pluralsight as part of their frontend team, developed a custom webpage for a PAC 12+3 Dean's Summit, and built a social media to-do list app as part of the Dandilyonn SEEDS Program. 
 Outside of tech, I love being creative. From painting, graphic design, and making 3D figurines, I do it all. Whether I’m building apps or bringing ideas to life through art, I enjoy blending logic and creativity in everything I do, with the hopes to create something meaningful to the public they can resonate with.

name: Justin Ellis
bio: I am Justin Ellis, a senior computer science student at the University of Utah.
I am a software engineering intern at TD Williamson, where I am gaining experience building real-world applications!
I am also a part of the Job Preppers capstone group, where we built innovative career prep tools for students and professionals.
My past experiences include working as a robotics intern at Fermilab, a web development intern at the U of U, and a software engineer at TDW.
I have a very well-rounded foundation in both hardware and software. I enjoy designing creative and user-friendly solutions.
I am always looking to improve my technical skills. Outside of school/tech, I am a huge basketball fan (the Knicks are my favorite team), golf, and track.
I also love to stay active by working out. I am always eager to take on new challenges that help me grow professionally and personally!

name: William Lin
bio: Hello, I’m William Lin! Thank you for taking the time to read my bio. I am a senior computer science student at the University of Utah and one of the full stack developers for the JobPreppers capstone group. I specialize in networking, data viz, cloud services, and full stack development, but most importantly I am a lifelong learner and student. My favorite aspect of my work is the opportunity to be a full stack developer, and I have dreams of developing my own indie video games once I graduate. I currently work at the University’s Center for High Performance Computing as a Networking and Monitoring Specialist, where I support critical data center infrastructure through code-driven solutions and data visualization. Before working at CHPC, I was a hardware technician, where I gained valuable experience about system architecture and technical troubleshooting. Outside of work, school, and tech, I am a lover of gaming, professional basketball, and staying fit and healthy at the gym. I’m very grateful for your interest in JobPreppers, and I hope we can meet in person sometime!

name: Trang Tran
bio: Hello. I'm Trang Tran, a senior computer science major at the University of Utah. I was a full-stack developer for Job Preppers, and I want to play a similar role in my future endeavors. I'm focusing on finding a future career that lets me build applications and websites that make a difference. A big part of my life story consists of me growing up in Idaho and eventually joining the Army National Guard. From there, I could help various people around the world. When I'm not coding, you'll find me walking my dog or hiking on a mountain as I try to hike all the national parks in the West.
